flower.name: aster
flower.label: Aster
flower.description: The name Aster comes from the Ancient Greek word meaning star, referring to the shape of the flower head.

flower.name: carnation
flower.label: Carnation
flower.description: Carnations require well-drained, neutral to slightly alkaline soil, and full sun. Examples include Gina Porto, Helen and Red Rocket

flower.name: daffodil
flower.label: Daffodil
flower.description: Daffodil is a common English name, sometimes used for all varieties, and commonly used by the American Daffodil Society

flower.name: rose
flower.label: Rose
flower.description: A rose is a woody perennial within the family Rosaceae. They form a group of erect shrubs, and climbing or trailing plants.

flower.name: orchid
flower.label: Orchid
flower.description: The orchid family is a diverse and widespread family in the order Asparagales. It is one of the largest families of flowering plants.
